meanings.definition: Compelling someone to do something against their will.
meanings.sent1: The teacher was forcing the students to complete their homework.
meanings.sent2: She was forcing him to apologize for his mistake.
meanings.sent3: The cat was forcing the dog to share its toy, much to everyone's surprise.
meanings.sent4: The storm was forcing the trees to bend and sway in the strong winds.
meanings.sent5: The detective was forcing the suspect to confess by presenting the evidence.

meanings.definition: Causing something to happen or develop more quickly.
meanings.sent1: The forcing winds made the kite fly higher in the sky.
meanings.sent2: The forcing pace of the project led to its completion ahead of schedule.
meanings.sent3: The forcing growth of the plants amazed the gardeners with its speed.
meanings.sent4: The forcing rain brought an end to the dry spell in the region.
meanings.sent5: The forcing sunlight accelerated the melting of the snow.

meanings.definition: A technique used in gardening to stimulate plants to grow or bloom out of season.
meanings.sent1: The gardener applied forcing to the tulip bulbs to have early blooms.
meanings.sent2: The greenhouse used forcing to produce fresh vegetables in the winter.
meanings.sent3: The forcing method allowed the roses to blossom in the middle of winter.
meanings.sent4: The forcing process helped the fruit trees yield ripe fruits earlier.
meanings.sent5: The forcing technique was successful in bringing color to the garden during the cold months.
